text: On tap at Republic 7 Corners. Pours a near clear copper with an orange hue and a white head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma has bread and grains supported by grass and a hint of citrus. Flavor starts with grains and bread but has a touch of grass and flora.

Draft at Meddlesome Moth, Dallas. Pours clear gold with an off-white head. Aroma of light malt, honey, and bread. Taste is light malt, honey, bread, floral notes, yeast, some fruity notes. Enjoyed this one.

On tap at brewpub. A clearish golden lager with a short lived white head. Aroma is herbal, grapefruity and cereal. Flavor is cereal, some grass. Finish is herbal hop, clean finish. Light to medium body, average carbonation.
on draft at brewery, nice dark malty strong lager. Some grassy bitterness, some spices. Pretty nice but the dark malts arent very refreshing.

On tap at tumans. Aroma is sharp malt. Pours clear golden. Flavor is intensely malty (I never thought Id ever write those words). Bready. Clean finish with just a hint of bitterness. Good solid light bodied hellerbock.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a vibrant dark honey color with a large fluffy orange-white head that left good lacing. The aroma was sweet and yeasty with sugar and golden fruit notes. The flavor was tangy, sweet and mildly boozy with notes of yeast, bread, table sugar and golden fruit. Medium length finish. Moderately full bodied. Well done.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with fluffy white head. Taste caramel, sweet, cereal. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Tap 25. It pours a golden yellow color with a creamy, frothy off white head. A golden Maibock! One of my favs. The aroma has some honey and bread. Light notes of citrus and floral hops. The flavor is full and malty with more honey, bread, light notes of pear, melon, flowers and citrusy hops. The hops are tasted mainly in the finish. Clean, with a silky mouthfeel. Lightly oily. Strong bitterness and good honey bread malt upfront. Great stuff. Super tasty and satisfying.
Tap at AleSmith into miniglobe. Clear orange color with 360 perfect lace. Nose is sweeter orange marmalade. Semi-dusty flavor, great malt presence, citrus juicy hop balance. Chalky mid palate.
Draft. Golden pour. This is a by-the-books maibock for sure, not super hoppy but a nice crish orange herbal hop character and a heavy bready malty body.

Pint at Star Bar. This is a brilliant amber with a crystal clear body. Man, Alesmith killed this style. Very clean and malty aroma with a kiss of noble hops and very mild bready lager yeast notes. The palate is smooth and medium full. Taking a drink is like biting into a loaf of bread and following it up with fresh roasted corn on the cob. A faint hint of toffee starts coming out. Ladies and gentlemen, this is a maibock.

Clear bright golden with a sticky foamy white top. Crisp bready but also slightly grassy nose. Bready and toasty flavor with a earthy grassy and lagerish undertone, actually pretty complex but a little too full of lager yeast.

Draught at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is cereal and grainy malt, light earthy and spicy hops with light kettle caramelized notes. Flavor is moderate, lightly sweet grainy and cereal malt with light earthy and spicy hops and bitterness and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
(En fût à la brasserie): Des éclats doranges dans une base céréalière déterminée et singulière. Lamertume est franche mais brève, buvabilité dithyrambique.
